content: wild at heart stripe is an asymmetrical triangular shawl knitted in fingering-weight yarn with a very simple garter stripe and eyelet pattern perfect for showing off your wildest skein you know you have that one skein in your stash that is so crazy you don t know what to do with it pair it with a mini-skein in a contrasting solid or tonal or even a contrasting variegated yarn show off your wild side with wild at heart stripe i designed wild at heart stripe to be a very quick and easy pattern with a simple eyelet stitch that will not get lost if you choose a crazy variegated yarn experienced knitters should find it exceedingly easy to knit this little shawl it could also be a great first asymmetrical triangular shawl for ambitious beginners a sock set would work perfectly with this shawl as long as there is some contrast between the two colors in the set pattern includes a chart for the eyelet section as well as written instructions i have another version without stripes which can be found here wild at heart 1 **needles and notions ** us size 6 4 0 mm or size to obtain gauge 24 32 in/60 81 cm circular needle recommended the pattern is written to maximize your yardage a small kitchen scale to weigh yarn would be handy **yarn & yardage ** mc at least 400 yd/366 m fingering weight merino or blend cc at least 87 yd/80 m fingering weight merino or blend **suggested yarn ** mc the lemonade shop simple sock 80% sw merino 20% nylon 400 yd/366 m/100 g 1 skein toxic oreo colorway cc black sheep dyeworks sock 100% superwash merino wool 87 yd/80 m/20 g 1 skein near black colorway **gauge ** in garter stitch 22 sts and 46 row per 4 in/10 cm unblocked 20 sts and 33 row per 4 in/10 cm blocked exact gauge not crucial but a large discrepancy in gauge especially row gauge will affect yarn usage **final measurements ** measurements will vary depending on your gauge and yardage used but the sample pictured measures 70 in/178 cm wingspan 15 in/38 cm depth measurements taken after blocking *pattern has been test knitted and tech edited * thank you and happy knitting 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/wild-at-heart-2
